TEXT: e1: The death penalty should be abandoned everywhere.
e2: From a Christian and humanistic perspective it is not allowed to kill someone.
CN RELATION: killing someone, Christian perspective (NotPartOf)/killing someone, humanistic perspective (NotPartOf)/killing, not allowed (HasProperty)

TEXT: e3: Proponents of the death penalty count on its deterring effect as well as the ultimate elimination of any potential threat.
CN RELATION: proponents of the death penalty, count on deterring effect (CapableOf)/proponents of the death penalty, elimination of potential threat (Desires)/death penalty, eliminates potential threat (CapableOf)/death penalty, deterring (HasProperty)/death penalty, deterring effect (HasA)/death penalty, elimination of potential threat (Causes)

TEXT: e4: However also the threat of the death penalty in the respective countries apparently cannot prevent murder and violent crime.
CN RELATION: death penalty, prevent murder (NotCauses)/death penalty, prevent violent crime (NotCauses)

TEXT: e5: Moreover it turns out time and again that innocent people are also convicted and executed.
CN RELATION: death penalty, conviction of innocent people (Causes)/death penalty, execution of innocent people (Causes)/innocent people, convicted (ReceivesAction)/innocent people, executed (ReceivesAction)
